title: PowerShell MCP Monitoring & Audit System
body: PowerShell MCP Server provides comprehensive monitoring and audit system with three logging mechanisms: 1) MCP Standard Logging - Real-time notifications/message for advanced MCP clients, stderr logging for VS Code/GitHub Copilot; 2) File-based Audit Trail - Structured logs in ./logs/powershell-mcp-audit-YYYY-MM-DD.log with security classifications, execution results, authentication events, error conditions, performance metrics (execution time, memory usage); 3) Real-time Monitoring Options - PowerShell: .\Simple-LogMonitor.ps1 -Follow, Separate Window: .\Start-SimpleLogMonitor.ps1, Manual: Get-Content ./logs/powershell-mcp-audit-*.log -Wait -Tail 10. Compliance features include PII sanitization, configurable log retention, structured JSON audit entries, real-time threat detection alerts, process tracking with Client PID â†’ Server PID lineage.
